title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: The issue is that the revert operation in the java editor is significantly slower than the close and reopen operations.
OB: The observed behavior is that when performing the revert operation in the java editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The expected behavior is that the revert operation should not take more time than the close and reopen operations, as it is essentially just replacing the contents of the window with the original.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 
2) Select the end of the first line and insert a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Perform the following steps: 
   a) Click on the close box in the editor tab. 
   b) Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog. 
   c) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
4) Observe that the close and reopen operation takes about 8 seconds.
5) Repeat steps 1) and 2) and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
6) Observe that the revert operation takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
